thread.title: Not future-ready

author: financialexpress.com
title: Not future-ready
text:
Other Articles 'India home to 2,080 uber-rich with wealth over $50 mn' Investing: Multiply your happiness Income tax laws and retirement: Top 7 empowering points Mortality protection gap in India has grown 11% every year between 2004 and 2014. It represents the difference between the life insurance cover typically required by a family and the resources they have available should a wage-earner pass away suddenly. A Swiss Re report shows that for every $100 needed for protection, only $7.8 of savings and insurance are in place for a typical Indian household, leaving a huge protection gap of $92.2. High protection gap is worrying and underlines the fragile nature of financial security for many families in the country.
 13, 2015 12:05 am
